news_header: Purdue Pharma and the Sackler family have agreed to pay up to $7.4 billion to settle claims related to OxyContin, amid the ongoing opioid crisis in the US.
news_text: Purdue Pharma and the Sackler family will pay up to $7.4 billion to settle claims regarding OxyContin, an opioid linked to the crisis in America. The Sacklers will contribute $6.5 billion, while Purdue will pay $900 million. The settlement aims to fund addiction treatment and prevention. It follows a rejected $6 billion deal in 2024 and is one of the largest settlements in lawsuits against companies responsible for the opioid epidemic. The deal requires court approval, and some details are still pending. Victims' advocates express hope for closure, emphasizing that the issue extends beyond financial compensation.
